channel.title: Do i need a router for A Private server
channel.description: I have a Cord running out of my box thing called Ethernet I'm Just Wondering

item.title: Do i need a router for A Private server
item.dc:creator: @us_sniper04 us sniper04
item.description:
@us_sniper04 wrote:

ok first you go to www.hamachi.cc/ and download it.

next you make ur account and all.

then you go to the 2nd button to the right(the one with the 3 little circles)

click on that and click creat a network.

now you will put in a name and a password so peopl can log into your networks.

for example.

my network is arrowscape1 and the password is 123

i recommend using 123 as your password since its easy.

you will want to make about 5-10 to start out with.

then you will see a be number at the top of hamachi.

for example mine is 5.122.199.10.

that is your ip. use that as your ip for people to log onto your server

good luck

Read full topic
item.source: Do i need a router for A Private server

item.title: Do i need a router for A Private server

@us_sniper04 wrote:

you dont need a router…for a private server because you can use hamachi. even though i highly recommend using a no-ip…hamachi is also a possiblity.

item.title: Do i need a router for A Private server
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

haxscape fan:

The boxes name is arris

Yes, but I mean I’m not an expert at this. I don’t really have memorized all the routers which you don’t need to log in and set the rule for. My advice is to easily find that out by yourself, by doing all you must, but logging in and setting rule for your router.

Good-Luck!

item.title: Do i need a router for A Private server
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

That’s not your router, bud. But, for some, you don’t necessarily have to have one. Take me for instance, I got my server up without logging into my router, but had to do every other specific detail. I guess it depends what kind you have.
